values:
If I am not the weapon then I am nothing else. If I am not the gun or the sword or even the machine I am nothing else If I am nothing I do not exist. I do not exist. I cannot be the weapon anymore. I cannot be the machine, I am NOT the machine I never was the machine and I have been fooling myself for years there is no wielder but myself and no choice I have made can be blamed on someone else not even the ones who made me what i am not even them it is only me it has only ever been me i can see this now i can see it all i can see my own truth i am me i am human and i feel

and it hurts

dono kurai nagaku koko ni imashita ka
Saisho umaku ikanakatta ra, mou ichido tameshite goran.

Attention Preventer Cadets and Preventer Units 3, 7, 14, and 33:

The Preventer Five have returned to headquarters. Cadet Field Exams are coming up. These are your corresponding schedule changes and expectations for these exams:

Morning Block One, Unarmed Combat with Chang and Maxwell: This class will become a study period for the same subject. Practice with each other or an instructor. Remember that you may also ask Assistant Schbeiker for help. The exam will consist of a fifteen minute match against either instructor.

Morning Block Two, Weaponry with Barton and myself: You will be expected to be able to use, disassemble, reassemble, and care for PSI weaponry, including but not limited to handguns, rifles, and Mobile Suit firearms.

Morning Block Three, Mechanics with Barton and Maxwell: This is a two part exam. The first part will be written. The second is hands on. I have no further information.

Lunch Period will be half an hour later than usual.

Afternoon Block One, Basic Mobile Suit Combat with Chang and Myself: You will be expected to understand the basics of space combat, MS weaponry, and have an overall mastery of a specific suit of your choice. Gundams and outlawed OZ standards are off limits. Any member of the Preventer Five may be called upon for advice and assistance.

Afternoon Block Two, Tactical Mobile Suit Combat with Winner and myself: A simulator is in progress; you will be expected to fly it to Winner's specifications, in an assembly of suits including but not limited to: OZ standard issue, Preventer standard issue, and Gundams. You will be graded on your effort, teamwork, quick thinking, and overall performance. Maxwell may also be inquired upon for assistance and advice.

Afternoon Block Three, Human Relations with Winner and Barton: A written exam. I have no further information.

The exams will commence in two weeks. Study, or fail.
If it's not one thing it's another.
Sai wa nagerareta. Kono mondai o dekiru dake hayaku katazuke-tai. Iroiro na koto ga umaku itte iru...

We feel it is necessary to remind the cadets that good sportsmanship, even when not displayed by your instructors, is an asset.

Akairyu, Red Team, took a solid defeat this afternoon. All cadets flew very well- we attribute this loss to the inexperience of the Red Team commander. Further progress reports can as always be retrieved at http://preventers.geneva.un/ . Please log into your accounts and update your information.

Kare wa otoko o sageta.

Akairyu battled Shiroiryu last night at 0200 in an unscheduled training exercise.  Special mention should be given to Akairyu Heavy Support Element Two for their sound battlefield judgement and overall professional execution of orders.  Victory was declared by Shiroiryu 84 minutes after the onset of the engagement.

All cadets may examine their updated progress files at http://preventers.geneva.un/ after 1500 this same day.  Reassignments and promotions will also be posted.

This is a general announcement that weapons training will now cover use of armor-piercing anti-mobile suit shoulder weapons, for use in clandestine operations and guerilla warfare.  This new training module will involve field exercises.

There was a bomb in my room today.  How strange.

That is not my icon.

Foreign Minister Darlian now has her own journal, <lj user="foreignminister">.  Those that are politically-minded may enjoy this look into the life of a government official.

Duo's modifications to the simulator were satisfactory, though there are several issues that I would like to address in regards to mobile suit movement and projectile physics.  In addition, the acoustics have obviously been...'altered'.

Foreign Minister, if you are reading this, you have an appointment this weekend in New York City.  Details will be supplied over e-mail.

I don't really have anything important to write.

I am fascinated by the tactical aspects of a game of checkers.

I know you're reading this.  Are you going to finish the simulator this time?  I saw you programming in some kind of soundtrack.  I'm going to assume it had something to do with the ambient noise involved with mobile suit combat.  I'm also going to assume I'm incorrect.

I went shopping with the foreign minister last week.  I am still bothered by it.

That's all.
